plot: Broadway legend Laney Fontaine transforms Lisa into a show-biz kid after Homer loses her chance at band camp.

When Homer loses $5,000 at a poker game with Broadway legend Laney Fontaine, the only way he is able to settle the bet is if he loans Lisa to Laney for a month. Then, Laney turns Lisa into a show biz kid and Marge and Homer fear they made a mistake letting her go. So they head to New York to get her back.

Laney Fontaine setting out on her career sunsetting one woman show seems to be an obvious reference to Elaine Stritch. Ms. Stritch had a similar run before retiring, although it lasted longer than Laney Fontaine's show. She was also a drinking, man's woman like the Fontaine character.

After losing Lisa's band camp money in a poker game to Moe's friend, ageing Broadway star Laney Fontaine, Homer agrees to Lisa going to Broadway to co-star in Laney's latest show. Fearing that they have made a mistake the family follows her - helped by Ned's Amish cousin - and find their daughter is doing very well, in fact too well for Laney's liking.—don @ minifie-1
